intro: Calais platycarpha, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal dunes, scrublands, and other dry habitats. Calais platycarpha is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native range.
